publicationStmt.publisher: Wellcome Library; Bibliotheca Alexandrina; King's College London

msContents.summary: 1 anonymously written compendium of various diseases and their treatment

msItem.title: Medical compendium describing various diseases and their treatment
msItem.note: The chapter sequence is not consistent and the author uses two different words - باب and فصل - for the same type of division. Each disease is described in a sequence: "necessary description" (السبب الموجب); "symptoms" (العرض) and "method of treatment" (التدبير).
msItem.incipit: Fol. 1a.1 فعلاجه يكون بالستكثار من الاغديه والاشربه المحموده
msItem.explicit: Fol. 164b.17 الغدا قليلًا قليلًا فلا يبطيء الفقاد والعضو وحل الرباط اول الامر وجب على العضو

foliation.catchwords: Catchwords obliterated, since the paper strips are pasted to the lower margins.

handNote.p: Ink: Black; headings and dividers are highlighted in red

list.item: Occasional traces of inferior restoration work.
Dividers (e.g. fol. 48a) are similar to those used in Christian Arabic manuscripts.
Fols. 1-7 and 156-164 have been restored later and contain typical Ottoman Arabic handwriting, with the occasional insertion of Syriac script.
Inner side of the front cover contains calculations.
Along with two scribbles, the inner side of the back cover contains the date: 1234 (AH) which corresponds to 1818-1819 AD.

accMat.p: Occasional traces of inferior restoration work. Dividers (e.g. fol. 48a) are similar to those used in Christian Arabic manuscripts. Fols 1 - 7 and 156 - 164 have been restored later and contain typical Ottoman Arabic handwriting with the occasional insertion of Syriac script. Inner side of the front cover contains calculations. Along with the two scribbles, the inner side of the back cover contains the date 1234 AH, which corresponds to AD 1818 - 1819.

history.provenance: Sāmī Ibrāhīm Ḥaddād (1986). Orthography suggests the origin on the territory of modern Syria or Lebanon.
